body_html: It's not just ExponentialMovingAverage, but also the accumulators used by optimizers that have this behavior. Anyone who's using either of these inside a scope of any kind would suffer backwards-incompatible checkpoints due to the naming difference. Especially given there is an easy workaround (i.e. do not create / use ExponentialMovingAverage or Optimizers inside a name scope), the pain that fixing this would cause outweighs the benefits.
